condition.name: The Spark
rule: You have the ability to power automata.
Your somatic component provides 10 power.
Your verbal component provides 10 power.
You can use verbal, somatic, hitpoint, willpower components to power automata.
You can gain this condition during character creation for 1 skillpoint.
condition.details: Some people are born with an innate ability to affect the primordial flow around them.

condition.name: Power Reserve
rule: You have access to a special "Power Reserve" component. This component provides 200 power and requires just one second of concentration to use.
You can have this condition multiple times. Each time gives you access to another use of the power reserve component during the same activation.
You can gain this condition during character creation for 5 skillpoints.
condition.details: Some people have an innate gift for Primordial magic that allows them to use much more powerful automata than they normally would be able to.

skill.name: Automata Crafting
rule: You have the ability to craft new automata. You will gain in character documents detailing this process.
Your somatic component provides 200 power.
Your verbal component provides 200 power.
You can use material and focus components to power automata.
skill.details: After learning how to power automata, the second thing an apprentice mage learns is how to craft his own automata.

skill.name: Element Focus
rule: Choose a Particle Type other than Divine. Automata that are Dominant of that type cost 500 power less to activate.
You can gain this skill multiple times. Each time you must select a different Particle Type.
skill.details: There are mages that focus on mastering a single element instead of all at once. They become masters of that element but may not have much control over the other elements.

skill.name: Component Crafting
skill.rule: You can find basic material components using a bit of matter and some energy. Spend 10 minutes crafting a component to get one basic material component.
skill.details: With a bit of time and concentration you can turn any ordinary thing into something you can use to power your automata.

item.name: Automata scroll
rule: Can hold an 8 by 10 automata grid.
Is always consumed if automata is activated, even if the automata is inscribed.
item.details: Cheap scrolls are often used to weave and sell one-time uses of specific automata.

item.name: Automata canvas
rule: Can hold a 10 by 16 automata grid.
Is always consumed if automata is activated, even if the automata is inscribed.
item.details: Larger than the scroll, which means it can hold more complex automata.

item.name: Automata wand
item.rule: Can hold a 4 by 8 automata grid.
item.details: Wands are usually used to hold simple inscribed spells.

item.name: Automata rod
item.rule: Can hold an 8 by 10 automata grid.
item.details: Rods are usually used to hold inscribed spells.

item.name: Automata staff
item.rule: Can hold a 10 by 12 automata grid.
item.details: Staffs usually hold the more complex inscribed spells.

item.name: Basic Material Component
rule: Provides 100 power when used to activate an automata.
The item is consumed after use.
item.physrep: A handful of fine sand, a puff of smoke, a cup of water or similar material.

item.name: Improved Material Component
rule: Provides 300 power when used to activate an automata.
The item is consumed after use.
item.physrep: A small rod of iron, a wedge of dried wood, a lit candle.

item.name: Superior Material Component
rule: Provides 1000 power when used to activate an automata.
The item is consumed after use.
item.physrep: A silver coin. A rabbit's foot.

item.name: Exquisite Material Component
rule: Provides 3000 power when used to activate an automata.
The item is consumed after use.
item.physrep: A gold coin. A piece of silk.

item.name: Extraplanar Material Component
rule: This is a special item made from parts acquired from different planes. If you wish to sell it, you will have to find a specific buyer. It cannot be bought normally.
Provides 6000 power when used to activate an automata.
The item is consumed after use.
item.physrep: A living flame from Danu's divine realm. The essence of a murder spirit. The threads woven by a fate weaver.

item.name: Basic Focus Component
item.rule: Provides up to 100 power when used to activate an automata. The item costs 18c for every 10 power it can supply.
item.physrep: A simple wooden staff. A pewter symbol hanging from a chain. A simple but elegant dagger.

item.name: Improved Focus Component
item.rule: Provides up to 300 power when used to activate an automata. The item costs 20c for every 10 power it can supply.
item.physrep: An ornate wooden staff. A sword with a large gem in the pommel. A slightly silly but well-made pointy hat.

item.name: Superior Focus Component
item.rule: Provides up to 1000 power when used to activate an automata. The item costs 24c for every 10 power it can supply.
item.physrep: A metal rod with a deamon's head at one end. A long pipe filled with expensive tobacco. A breastplate with a gold dragon embossed on the front.

item.name: Exquisite Focus Component
item.rule: Provides up to 3000 power when used to activate an automata. The item costs 30c for every 10 power it can supply.
item.physrep: A gold and silver crown set with several large gems. A wood and metal staff with a fist-sized diamond in its top. A curved dagger made of pure gold with an ivory hilt.

item.name: Extraplanar Focus Component
rule: Provides up to 10000 power when used to activate an automata.
This is a special item made from parts acquired from different planes. If you wish to sell it, you will have to find a specific buyer. It cannot be bought normally.
item.physrep: A beastling's horn. A good and evil rock from the realm of Ratish. An ethereal book containing stories written by hundreds of storytelling spirits.
